Human Trafficking Statistics in Georgia

click here for more info.

Human trafficking is a form of modern slavery that occurs in every state, including Georgia. The NHTH works closely with service providers, law enforcement, and other professionals in Georgia to serve victims and survivors of trafficking, respond to human trafficking cases, and share information and resources.

SINCE 2007

  • Total Contacts: 6,697
  • Total Cases: 2,109
  • Total Victims - Moderate: 3,600i
  • Total Victims - High: 5,244

TRAFFICKING PREVENTION

In simplistic terms, trafficking exists because of supply and demand. A demand for free labor, sex, organs, etc. fuels the need for human bodies to exploit. The crime, however, is very complex and there is no easy solution. We do know that informed citizens, empowered law enforcement, improved laws, and better victim services are all essential to addressing this issue. There are many organizations that focus on varying aspects of prevention. Operation Underground Railroad specializes in empowering law enforcement and aftercare partners around the world with the tools and resources they need to better address trafficking in their communities. There are organizations that specialize in trafficking and sexual exploitation prevention in most major cities within the United States. The videos below will introduce you to a few effective prevention initiatives. Here are links to some frontrunner organizations in trafficking prevention:

  • https://polarisproject.org/
  • http://endsexualexploitation.org/
  • https://www.state.gov/j/tip/id/help/
  • https://love146.org/notanumber/
  • http://www.fairgirls.org/
  • http://www.gems-girls.org/
  • http://www.prevention-project.org/home/prevention-project-program/
  • https://freedomnetworkusa.org/
  • https://www.dhs.gov/see-something-say-something
